content.description: Sit start with both hands on the long crimp inside the cave. Then reach up with your left hand for a good hold up and outside of the cave. Continue up with other holds you find/prefer to use, then get a high left heel hook to help you pull over the overhang/roof. Crux is the start hold and reason it is V1-2. Very fun short climb with the heel hook and mantle!
content.protection: A pad. Short problem, falling is not dangerous.
content.location: On the North face of Pipsqueak boulder

content.description: Same start as Pipsqueak with your left hand on the crimp in the cave, but have your right hand outside on the closest mini side jug on the face. Instead of going out of the cave to the left and up, go right and up out onto the face.
Same start as Heeleyhookey, but instead of mantling right after getting the lip and a heel hook, travers all the way to the right corner on the lip and mantel there.

On the slightly overhung and pretty blank wall. Sit start with your left hand on the left arete/slope/diagonal ledge and your right hand inside the little crack in the middle right of the wall. I get my first and middle finger inside a small almost pocket like spot in the crack. Then have your right foot on a sideways foot hold and your left foot heel-hooking the arete. Get yourself off the ground and reach up for the top of the wall while swinging. Get your left hand up, a left heel hook high, and top out with a mantle. To make this route more fun and longer, you can traverse on the lip, which is another problem.
content.protection: Pad, maybe two if you're going to traverse on the lip
content.location: This is the south side opposite of the side of Pipsqueak. Blank overhung wall that is pretty dang short.

content.description: Sit start on two juggy holds angling towards/next to each other, then push up and get your right hand out to a slopey hold. After that get your left hand to a crimp and then bump up to a smaller crimp above that before reaching for a jug with your left hand at the top of the climb. Start is the crux.
content.location: To the right of Pipsqueak on a corner. Look for two diagonal juggy/ledgy holds close to each other.
